snippet.textDisplay: Well it did come out in 1992. There weren't that many options at this time period for the SNES...I suppose Final Fantasy IV was out (I had to look that one up). The dialog and story while it had potential were pretty laughable in execution. I did a huge write up on it back in the early 2000s, I think I gave it a 6 or 6.5/10 which sure sounds crappy but my scale leaned towards 5 being about as boring average as it gets and anything lower was just putrid. Oh and I love Paladin's Quest I honestly don't see much wrong with it at all. 7th Saga sure there is a litany of reasons but Paladin's Quest wasn't liked because it wasn't Final Fantasy? Made no sense.
snippet.textOriginal: Well it did come out in 1992. There weren't that many options at this time period for the SNES...I suppose Final Fantasy IV was out (I had to look that one up). The dialog and story while it had potential were pretty laughable in execution. I did a huge write up on it back in the early 2000s, I think I gave it a 6 or 6.5/10 which sure sounds crappy but my scale leaned towards 5 being about as boring average as it gets and anything lower was just putrid. Oh and I love Paladin's Quest I honestly don't see much wrong with it at all. 7th Saga sure there is a litany of reasons but Paladin's Quest wasn't liked because it wasn't Final Fantasy? Made no sense.

snippet.textDisplay:
Compared to other games from the same era yeah, it's a pretty crappy RPG. The difficulty is all over the place, the mapping system would never exist in the form that it was in today's games, the story is just pure unadulterated fuckery. It took me several playthroughs as well as lots of research to figure out who the fuck the hero is talking about in the final boss fight. Even comparing it to games like Paladin's Quest Etc it has glaring flaws I can't ignore. I would like to State for the record I enjoyed the hell out of it. It was one of my favorite games when I was younger. I loved switching spirits on the Fly, and while I will criticize the elemental cards system at used, at the time I found it fresh even if it ran out incredibly quickly and was unnecessarily simple or just plain unnecessary period in the face of so many games that did the same thing so much better in that era, I can comfortably call this one of the worst RPGs released for the SNES. Fuck, even the Dragonball and Sailor Moon RPGs did RPG better.

Definitely dig pretty much every song from this game though. The soundtrack in visuals are phenomenal and there weren't many dungeon crawling games to compare it to on the Super Nintendo
snippet.textOriginal:
Compared to other games from the same era yeah, it's a pretty crappy RPG. The difficulty is all over the place, the mapping system would never exist in the form that it was in today's games, the story is just pure unadulterated fuckery. It took me several playthroughs as well as lots of research to figure out who the fuck the hero is talking about in the final boss fight. Even comparing it to games like Paladin's Quest Etc it has glaring flaws I can't ignore. I would like to State for the record I enjoyed the hell out of it. It was one of my favorite games when I was younger. I loved switching spirits on the Fly, and while I will criticize the elemental cards system at used, at the time I found it fresh even if it ran out incredibly quickly and was unnecessarily simple or just plain unnecessary period in the face of so many games that did the same thing so much better in that era, I can comfortably call this one of the worst RPGs released for the SNES. Fuck, even the Dragonball and Sailor Moon RPGs did RPG better.

Definitely dig pretty much every song from this game though. The soundtrack in visuals are phenomenal and there weren't many dungeon crawling games to compare it to on the Super Nintendo

snippet.textDisplay: This game is awesome. When I played this back in the day, I absolutely hated anything first-person, but this game has awesome music, an imaginative fight sequence (the monsters in the cards move!! Simply awesome), and is really fun to play. It's one of those games that can be beat quickly, but is still fun to play again and again.
snippet.textOriginal: This game is awesome. When I played this back in the day, I absolutely hated anything first-person, but this game has awesome music, an imaginative fight sequence (the monsters in the cards move!! Simply awesome), and is really fun to play. It's one of those games that can be beat quickly, but is still fun to play again and again.

snippet.textDisplay: One of the few games Ishikawa composed for outside of the Kirby series. You can definitely feel the Kirby vibe in this game's soundtrack. Arcana was a pretty good first person RPG, I rented it and finished it as a kid, I had a fun time.
snippet.textOriginal: One of the few games Ishikawa composed for outside of the Kirby series. You can definitely feel the Kirby vibe in this game's soundtrack. Arcana was a pretty good first person RPG, I rented it and finished it as a kid, I had a fun time.
